content: The largest salt flat in the world, Salar de Uyuni, can be found in which South American country?

Salar de Uyuni, the largest salt flat in the world, is located in Bolivia, a country in western-central South America. This extraordinary natural wonder covers over 10,582 square kilometers and is known for its otherworldly beauty, especially during the rainy season when it forms a mirror-like surface reflecting the sky. The salt flat is also a significant source of lithium, playing a crucial role in global battery production.
